item.title: Terms and Conditions
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
Connuct Limited Terms of Use   Please read this agreement carefully before using the services provided by Connuct Limited (Company or Connuct Care).   These terms and conditions (Terms of Use) set out the basis upon which you may use the website Connuct.co.uk, or the Mobile App (Link 1 to Play store or Link 2 to Apple App store) for the services provided therein. Additionally, the Terms of Use sets out our privacy policy.   By accessing or using this service, you agree to be bound by the Terms of Use.   The Company may revise the Terms of Use at any time by updating the same on its web site or respective mobile apps. We will notify you immediately such reviews have been made and our continued use of this Website or Mobile Apps following the notification that any changes to the Terms of Use have been made constitutes acceptance of the changes and will be binding on you.  
  1. Definitions and Interpretation
Cancellation Fee means a fee of GBP 20 which will be paid to the Carer Carers mean individuals holding themselves out as willing to deliver Carer Services to Care Seekers on a self-employed basis. Care Seeker means care and nursing homes that use the platform for seeking Carers. Care Seeker Payment Rate means the amount recommended by the Company as the amount payable per hour by the Care Seeker for the Carer Services. Carer Services means the care service provided by the Carer on the terms agreed between the Care Seeker and the Carer. CQC Regulations means guidance issued by the Care Quality Commission (CQC) dated March 2015 on The Scope of Registration under the Health and Social Care Act 2008 or any other guidance subsequently published at a later date by the CQC as substituting the Scope of Registration dated March 2015. DBS Check means the checks carried out by the Disclosure and Barring Service, previously known as the Criminal Records Bureau (CRB). Engagement means the agreement between a Care Seeker and a Carer for the delivery of Care Services following an Introduction. Hourly Carer Rate means an amount equal to the Care Seeker Payment Rate less the Introductory Commission Fee payable by the Company to the Carer for the delivery of the Care Services. Introduction means the introduction of the Carer to the Care Seeker by the Company. Introductory Commission Fee means the 10% + VAT commission charged by the Company on an Introduction or any other percentage and its VAT equivalent substituted therefore and published as the Introductory Commission Fee on the Platform from time to time. Mobile App means the Companys mobile phone application for the Services in the Google Play Store or Apple iTunes store. Platform means the structure described in Clause 2.1 together with the Website and the Mobile App through which the Company provides the Services. Services means the service of introducing Carers to Care Seekers provided by the Company. You means the Carer. VAT means Value Added Tax. Website means www.connuct.co.uk. UK means the United Kingdom.   In the Terms of Use, unless the context otherwise requires:
  1. headings are for convenience only and do not affect interpretation
  2. words importing one gender include every gender;
  • words importing the singular number include the plural number and vice versa;
  1. reference to a person includes any entity recognised by law and vice versa;
  2. references to currency are in British Sterling (GBP).
 
  1. General Terms
    • The Platform
The Company provides the Services though the Platform as a means for Carers and Care Seekers to connect, interact and arrange care contracts between one another. This is facilitated through providing services which include but are not limited to:
  1. A searchable online database of Carers;
  2. Communication tools to facilitate interaction between Carers and Care Seekers for services provided or required;
  • [Payment system to facilitate the payment of fees by Care Seekers to Carers]; and
  1. Feedback tools on care provided.
    • The Company
      • The Company is established to operate as an introductory agency in line with the CQC Regulations.
      • The Company is an introductory agency only and does not employ carers, nor does the Company act as an employment agency or care agency. In line with the CQC Regulations, the Company is not permitted to make changes to the care plan, provide rotas or effect control over the delivery of care. The terms of the care plan, rotas or the delivery of care are to be agreed between the Carer and the Care Seeker.
    • Limitations of the Service
      • The Company is not involved in the delivery of the Carer Services.
      • The Company does not have control over the quality, timing, safety, legality or any other aspect whatsoever of the truth or accuracy of the information posted, the Carer Services, nor the integrity, or responsibility for any of the actions whatsoever of the Care Seekers.
      • The tools provided by the Company are used by Care Seekers and Carers at their own risk and there is no guarantee that these tools will work optimally, not be subject to downtime, or removed from service at any point in time. The Company does not accept any liability for losses or damages caused by the temporary unavailability of the service or technical errors.
 
  1. Rules for use of the Service
    • Eligibility for use of the Services
      • Carers
By registering and using, from time to time, the tools provided by the Company you confirm on each occasion that
  1. you are 18 years old or over;
  2. you have the right to form legally binding contracts under English law;
  • you have the right to work in the UK;
  1. all the information provided by you is correct and accurate, including any stated care requirements or specific needs; and
  2. you accept and will abide by our terms and conditions.
    • Care Seekers
By registering and using, from time to time, the tools provided by the Company you confirm on each occasion that
  1. you have an active registration with CQC for providing care services;
  2. you have the right to form legally binding contracts under English law;
  • all information provided by you is correct and accurate including any stated care requirements or specific needs; and
  1. you accept and will abide by our terms and conditions.
    • Login and Password
      • When you become a registered user, you create a password and login name (email address). You agree to be entirely responsible for any and all activities that occur under your login name.
      • You are entirely responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your password and login. You may change your password at any time by following instructions published on the Platform.
      • You agree to immediately notify the Company of any unauthorised use of your login name or any other breach of security known to you.
    • Information Required
      • The Carer shall, upon registration, provide the Company with copies of the following documents:
        1. satisfactory evidence of the Carers identity, which shall include, but not limited to the Carers official photographic identification and recent proof of address;
        2. evidence that the Carer is legally allowed to work in the United Kingdom;
  • evidence of the DBS check results, if available; and
  1. copies of qualifications, training certificates and authorisations, where available, obtained and relating to the position of a carer in the United Kingdom.
  • The Carer shall also provide the Company with the names of at least two references who the Carer agrees the Company may approach at any time for the purpose of obtaining references about the Carer.
  • The Care Seeker shall, upon registration, provide the Company with copies of the following documents:
    1. evidence of the Care Seekers registration with the CQC; and
    2. copies of the Care Seekers incorporation documents, memorandum of association or other evidence that the Care Seeker has the right to form legally binding contracts.
  • Background check
    • The Company will make reasonable efforts to check the identity and information provided by Carers. This includes visual examination of:
  1. identification documents to confirm identity;
  2. stated qualifications and training certificates, where available; and
  • documentary evidence of DBS Check submitted to the Company.
    • Where Carers cannot provide documentary evidence of having passed a DBS Check within the past 3 years, the Company may perform a DBS Check via an external provider.
    • The Company may conduct a check of a Carers stated employment history or care experience, and of the Carers references.
    • By using the Platform the Carer authorises the Company to carry out certain background checks and audits at a time of their choosing. The Company reserves the right but not the obligation to use a third party to scan the Carers personal information on an ongoing basis against a variety of sources which may include, but are not limited to, sex offender registries, criminal registries and other legally available databases and resources.
    • The Company has no obligation to perform any of the checks mentioned in these Terms of Use and the Carer and Care Seeker each releases the Company from all liability associated with the result of such checks or the failure to conduct such checks.
  • Care Seekers Assessment of Carers
The Company strongly recommends that Care Seekers carry out their own assessment of a Carers suitability before engaging their services, including but not limited to:
  1. verifying the Carers identification documents;
  2. verifying the Carers training, qualifications, authorisations and suitability;
  • verifying the Carers DBS Check results; and
  1. verifying the Carers references and employment history.
  • Allowed use
    • Carers and Care Seekers are not permitted to use the Platform for anything other than: (i) sending genuine responses regarding the Carer Services (ii) making / reviewing / changing bookings; (iii) checking feedback, (iv) changing billing information and reviewing invoices where relevant and (v) communicating with representatives of the Company by phone, email or live chat to arrange bookings, seek advice or activate a the dispute resolution process.
    • The use of automated systems, manual copying or software to extract data from the Platform for commercial purposes, is prohibited unless with a written licence agreement with the Company.
    • Any breach of these terms renders the Carer and/or Care Seeker liable for damages for any resulting loss.
  1. Carer Representations, Warranties and Obligations
    • Representations and Warranties
      • The Carer represents and warrants that he or she has adequate public liability insurance cover for the delivery of Care Services.
      • The Carer represents and warrants that he or she is self-employed and is responsible for his or her tax liabilities.
      • The Carer represents and warrants that it has never been the subject of a complaint, restraining order or any other legal action for which he or she was arrested for, charged with, or convicted of any criminal offence involving violence, abuse, neglect, theft or fraud, or any offence that involves endangering the safety of others, dishonesty, negligence or drugs, and are not nor have ever been on the sex offenders register or other similar list.
      • The Carer represents and warrants that all the information he or she has provided the Company for the purpose of the Introduction is true, accurate and complete in every material respect.
      • These representations and warranted will be deemed repeated each time a Carer uses the Platform to connect with a Care Seeker or the Company, as the case may be.
    • Obligations
      • The Carer shall not engage in any conduct which is detrimental to the interests of the Company, which would negatively affect the Companys relationship with the Care Seeker or is likely to bring the Company into disrepute.
      • The Carer shall provide the information required by the Company in clause 3.3.1 and 3.3.2 of this Terms of Use.
      • The Carer consents to the disclosure by the Company to the Care Seeker of all relevant information delivered by the Carer to the Company (which is required to progress an Introduction or which is requested by the Care Seeker) including but not limited to copies of qualifications, authorisations, DBS Check results and/or references.
      • The Carer shall immediately inform the Company should there be any reason or circumstance under which it would be detrimental to the interests of the Company, or the Care Seeker, for the Carer to take up an Engagement with a Care Seeker or to continue its registration with the Company.
      • [The Carer agrees that the amount published by the Company as the Hourly Carer Rate is a fair and reasonable amount for the Care Services and agrees to accept this amount from the Company as payment for the Care Services].
      • The Carer shall negotiate and agree an Engagement with the Care Seeker on such terms as are acceptable to the Carer.
      • In the event that the Carer is unable to honour an Engagement that has been agreed with a Care Seeker the Carer shall notify the Care Seeker as soon as practicable.
      • The Carer is not obligated to accept any Introduction offered to him/her through the Company.
  1. Care Seeker Representations, Warranties and Obligations
    • Representations and Warranties
      • The Care Seeker represents and warrants that that it is a service provider engaged in the business of providing personal care to individuals including care or nursing homes.
      • The Care Seeker confirms that it is registered with the CQC to provide care services.
      • The Care Seeker represents and warrants that it will conduct its own independent verification of any Carer introduced by the Company.
      • The Care Seeker represents and warrants that it will enter into an Engagement with the Carer governing the delivery of the Care Services by the Carer.
      • The Care Seeker represents and warrants that it shall engage the Carer on the basis that the Carer is self-employed and therefore neither the Care Seeker nor the Company will be required to deduct any income tax or national insurance contributions from payments made to the Carer.
      • The Care Seeker represents and warrants that it is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against employees, consultants and other service providers on the basis of skin colour, nationality, disability, gender or any other potential source of discrimination.
      • The Care Seeker represents and warrants that it has never been the subject of a complaint, restraining order or any other legal action for which it was charged with, or convicted of any criminal offence involving violence, abuse, neglect, theft or fraud, or any offence that involves endangering the safety of others, dishonesty, negligence or drugs, and are not nor have ever been on the sex offenders register or other similar list.
      • The Care Seeker represents and warrants that all the information it has provided the Company for the purpose of the Introduction is true, accurate and complete in every material respect.
      • These representations and warranted will be deemed repeated each time a Care Seeker uses the Platform to connect with a Carer or the Company, as the case may be.
    • Obligations
      • The Care Seeker shall provide the information required by the Company in clause 3.3.3 of this Terms of Use.
      • The Care Seeker agrees that the amount calculated as the Care Seeker Payment Rate is a fair and reasonable amount for the Care Services and agrees to pay such rate for the Care Services.
      • The Care Seeker shall pay, in full and without any deduction or set off, the Care Seeker Payment Rate as agreed for the provision of the Care Services. The Care Seeker confirms that by using the Platform, it has the funds available to pay for every Engagement it enters into with the Carer.
      • The Care Seeker shall make all payments for the Carer Services due under any Engagement through the Platform and shall not make any attempts to pay the Carer outside the Platform.
 
  1. The Companys Obligations
    • The Company shall endeavour to secure suitable introductions for the Carer but shall be under no obligation to find an introduction for the Carer at any time.
    • The Company does not accept any responsibility and shall not be liable for any loss suffered by the Carer by reason of the Carers decision to resign from his/her current employment or any existing engagement before or after receipt of a Care Seekers offer on the Platform.
  1. Payments
    • Payments
      • As a separate service from the Introduction and without any relation to the Care Service agreed solely between the Care Seeker and the Carer, the Company shall provide to the Care Seeker and the Carer a facility for making payments for the Engagement from time to time.
      • The Care Seeker and Carer agree that all payments for the Carer Services delivered pursuant to an Engagement shall be made through the Platform. Any attempts to pay outside the Platform must be reported to the Company immediately and such attempts will lead to sanctions including with limitation immediate account suspension.
      • The Companys current payment provider is Natwest and all credit and debit card information is held securely and is PCI compliant. For customers wishing to pay by BACS, this will be determined on a case by case basis.
    • Payment Amounts
      • The Company shall publish from time to time a Care Seeker Payment Rate which shall consist of:
        1. The Companys determination of the appropriate market hourly rate for the Carer Services; and
        2. An Introductory Commission Fee payable to the Company for effecting the Introduction.
      • The Company shall pay to the Carer, in return for the delivery of the Care Services, an Hourly Carer Rate equal to the Care Seeker Payment Rate less the Introductory Commission Fee.
    • Refunds
The Company as a general rule does not provide refunds or credits for an Introduction.
  • Cancellations
    • If the Care Seeker cancels an Engagement within a 4 hour period prior to the commencement of the Engagement, the Care Seeker will be billed the Cancellation Fee.
    • In exceptional circumstances and where both parties agree, the Company will exercise its discretion to void the payment of the Cancellation Fee in cases where the cancellation has taken place within a 4 hour period prior to the commencement of the Engagement and a where payment of such Cancellation Fee has been received.
  • Liability Cap
Care Seeker acknowledges that the Companys total liability to them whether in respect of an Engagement or otherwise and whether based in negligence, breach of contract, misrepresentation or otherwise shall not exceed the value of the total Introductory Commission Fee paid by the Care Seeker to the Company in respect of that Engagement.
  1. Dispute Resolution
    • Where there is a disagreement between Care Seeker and Carer, either the Care Seeker or Carer can invoke the dispute resolution process by notifying the Company by email at complaints@connuct.co.uk
    • The Company will examine the service arrangement, compliance with terms, user analytics data including (but not limited to) visit system logs, messaging and other communication, verification, feedback and previous history and any submissions by either party.
    • In resolving the dispute, the Company reserves the right at its sole discretion, where it has received payment from the Care Seeker for an Engagement, to defer payment, reimburse or cease contractual payments at any time during the process.
  1. Limitation of Liability
    • Nothing in this Terms of Use shall exclude or limit the liability of the Carer or Care Seeker for death or personal injury.
    • The Carer and the Care Seeker agree that the Company shall not be liable to the either the Carer or the Care Seeker, or to any other third party, including, but not limited to the Carer or Care Seekers family or their successors, heirs and assigns, or any other person, for incidental or consequential losses, damages or expenses, directly or indirectly arising from any action or failure to act. It is agreed that there is no representation, warranty, collateral agreement or condition affecting this Terms of Use except as expressed in it.
    • The Carer acknowledges that the decision to accept an Engagement is the sole responsibility of the Carer and the Care Seeker acknowledges that the decision to employ a Carer is the sole responsibility of the Care Seeker. The Company gives no warranty, representation or undertaking as to the history, character, suitability, honesty of any Carer or Care Seeker nor as to the completeness, truthfulness or accuracy of any information provided by the Carer or Care Seeker.
    • The Carer and the Care Seeker acknowledge the risks inherent in participating in an Introduction, an Engagement and on the Platform, and hereby waive all rights to any claim for damages from, and relieve, release, and forever discharge from any claim for damages, the Company and any and all of the Companys directors, officers and affiliates arising from an Introduction, Engagement or use of the Platform.
    • The Company does not accept any liability whatsoever for the misrepresentation, loss, damage, injury, delay, claims or expense of any description arising out of an Introduction or an Engagement.
    • The Company does not accept any liability for claims, demands or direct or indirect damages arising from disputes between Care Seekers and Carers.
    • To the extent permitted by law, the Company will not be liable for any indirect or consequential loss or damage whatsoever (including without limitation loss of business, opportunity, data, profits) arising out of or in connection with the use of the Platform provided by the Company.
 
  1. Indemnity
Care Seekers and Carers undertake to indemnify the Company and keep the Company fully indemnified at all times from and against any actions, proceedings, claims, demands, costs (to include without prejudicing the generality of this clause, the legal costs of the Company), awards or damages howsoever arising directly or indirectly as a result of any breach or non-performance by the Carer and/or Care Seeker of any of the Carer and/or Care Seekers obligations, undertakings or warranties as set out within these Terms of Use.  
  1. Feedback and customer reviews
    • Care Seekers and Carers will be asked to leave qualitative and/or quantitative feedback on their experience. The feedback will affect the partys ranking on platform. Feedback should be provided honestly and you must not attempt to falsify, manipulate or coerce the other party by threatening negative feedback.
    • Any attempt by a Carer and/or Care Seeker to influence feedback on his or her performance or to try to change a Carer and/or Care Seekers opinion unduly will be penalised by the Company.
    • The Company reserves the right to remove any defamatory, abusive or offensive feedback at our discretion but are not obliged to do so.
    • Care Seekers and Carers agree to provide an exclusive and perpetual right for the Company to publish reviews related to them.
 
  1. Safeguarding Policy
    • The Company takes the safety of all parties using the platform extremely seriously and complies with all relevant legislation including the Care Act 2010, the Mental Capacity Act 2005 and the Safeguarding of Vulnerable Adults Act. In instances where we deem a "vulnerable" adult is at risk of exploitation or any type of harm and we have received evidence to indicate that this is the case, we will comply with the applicable legislation and refer the relevant parties to the nearest Local Authority's Adult Safeguarding Team. Although the Company does not directly provide care, we take our duties as a responsible organisation seriously and will endeavour to ensure a duty of care to all participants on the platform.
    • In instances where there is evidence to suggest that a Carer and/or Care Seeker may not be able to safely and competently use the Services, the Company reserves the right at its absolute discretion to limit access to the Platform on a temporary or permanent basis.
 
  1. Complaints Policy
    • The Company takes all customer complaints seriously and is committed to learning from mistakes and improving our Service for both current and prospective Care Seekers and Carers.
    • If the Carer and/or Care Seeker has a complaint, please send this by email to complaints@connuct.co.uk. The Company will normally respond within 24 hours (i.e. one business day). The Company will investigate any matter referred and take appropriate action where necessary.
    • The Company will investigate every complaint received and will take proportionate action ranging from verbal and written feedback to suspension of Platform accounts.
 
  1. Privacy Policy
    • The Company will comply with its obligations under the Data Protection Act 1998 in respect of Carers and the Care Seekers personal data.
    • By registering with the Company and accepting these Terms of Use, the Carer and the Care Seeker consent to the Company processing his or her personal data (including sensitive personal data) so that the Company may properly provide the Service in accordance with these Terms of Use, and expressly consents to the use of his or her personal data as required to facilitate an Engagement on the Platform.
    • To the extent that any data or information belonging to a Carer and/or Care Seeker is personal data within the meaning of the Data Protection Act 1998 or equivalent legislation in the territory:
  1. The Company will not transmit such data and information to a country or territory outside the European Economic Area without the Carer and/or Care Seekers prior express written consent; and
  2. The Company will take such technical and organisational measures against unauthorised or unlawful processing of such data and information and against accidental loss or destruction of, or damage to, such data and information.
  • The Carer and/or Care Seeker may formally request, in writing, to see any information and personal data about themselves which is held by the Company. The Company will aim to provide the information requested within 14 days of receipt of such request.
  • The Platform may, from time to time, contain links to and from websites of Companys partner networks, advertisers and affiliates. If a Carer and/or Care Seeker follows a link to any of these websites, the Carer and/or Care Seeker should note that these websites have their own privacy policies and that the Company does not accept any responsibility or liability for these policies. The Carer and/or Care Seeker should check these policies before submitting any personal data to these websites.
  1. Governing Law
    • The Terms of Use and any dispute arising out of the Platform and/or the Services shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the law of England and Wales.
    • The courts of England and Wales shall have exclusive jurisdiction to settle any dispute or claim that arises out of or in connection with these Terms of Use or in connection with the Platform and/ or the Service.
 
  1. Contact Information:
If you have any questions about the Terms of Use or the Services provided by the Company please contact us at: terms@connuct.co.uk

item.title: FAQ
item.dc:creator: user
item.content:encoded:
1. Who should register?
Any individual who does not want to be bound by a regular working contract and want to work at thier own convenience. The Platform provides interface where Caregivers can get notifications on care requirements posted by Carehomes and can choose to The Platform provides interface where Caregivers can get SMS and App based notifications on care requirements posted by Carehomes within the distance the caregivers are willing to travel and can then choose to accept (or reject) the temporary work.
